Title: Getting Started with QR-Based Restaurant Management System API

Nodes.Text: API for browsing menu items and placing orders in a QR-based restaurant system.
The SDK requires **Go version 1.18 or above**.
Resolve all the SDK dependencies, using the `go get` command.
The following section explains how to use the qrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi library in a new project.
- Add the following lines to your application's `go.mod` file:

```go
replace qrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi => ".\\Random Directory" // local path to the SDK

require qrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi v0.0.0
```
- Resolve the dependencies in the updated `go.mod` file, using the `go get` command.

Steps.Title: Add SDK as a Dependency to the Application

Nodes.Text: The following parameters are configurable for the API Client:

Data: Configurable http client options like timeout and retries.
Represents the logger configurations for API calls
The Credentials Setter for OAuth 2 Bearer token

Nodes.Text: The API client can be initialized as follows:

This API uses the following authentication schemes.
* [`bearerAuth (OAuth 2 Bearer token)`]($h/__auth_BearerAuth)
Documentation for accessing and setting credentials for bearerAuth.

Data: The OAuth 2.0 Access Token to use for API requests.

Nodes.Text: **Note:** Required auth credentials can be set using `WithBearerAuthCredentials()` by providing a credentials instance with `NewBearerAuthCredentials()` in the configuration initialization and accessed using the `BearerAuthCredentials()` method in the configuration instance.
You must provide credentials in the client as shown in the following code snippet.
This page can contain Tutorials/Guides/Changelogs or any information that API providers want to expose to their users besides what is auto-generated by Apimatic.

* [Menu]($e/Menu)
* [Order]($e/Order)
Endpoints for browsing menu items
The instance of the `MenuApi` class can be accessed from the API Client.
menuApi := client.MenuApi()

Nodes.Title: List Menu Items
Nodes.Name: ListMenuItems
Nodes.Description: Returns the full list of menu items currently available for ordering.
Nodes.ResponseText: This method returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `Data` property of this instance returns the response data which is of type [models.MenuResponse]($m/MenuResponse).

ReturnTypeExample.Text:
{
  "success": true,
  "count": 2,
  "data": [
    {
      "_id": "66cfe9b1f23a4a0012ab0001",
      "name": "Margherita Pizza",
      "description": "Classic pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella, and basil",
      "price": 1199.0,
      "category": "Pizza",
      "image": "https://cdn.example.com/img/margherita.jpg",
      "isAvailable": true
    },
    {
      "_id": "66cfe9b1f23a4a0012ab0002",
      "name": "Chicken Biryani",
      "description": "Spiced rice with marinated chicken",
      "price": 899.0,
      "category": "Main",
      "image": "https://cdn.example.com/img/biryani.jpg",
      "isAvailable": true
    }
  ]
}

Response.Description:
List of menu items

Nodes.Text: Endpoints for creating and viewing orders
The instance of the `OrderApi` class can be accessed from the API Client.
orderApi := client.OrderApi()

Nodes.Title: Place Order
Nodes.Name: PlaceOrder
Nodes.Description: Creates an order for the specified items and table.
Nodes.ResponseText: This method returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance. The `Data` property of this instance returns the response data which is of type [models.OrderResponse]($m/OrderResponse).

MethodSignature.Text:
PlaceOrder(
    ctx context.Context,
    body models.OrderInput) (
    models.ApiResponse[models.OrderResponse],
    error)

Parameters.Name: body
Parameters.Description: Order payload including items, table number, and customer details.

UsageExample.HttpCallTemplate: {"method":"POST","url":"https://restaurant-api-i70b.onrender.com/api/order/place-order{% capture inline_query_capture_876234 %}{% endcapture %}{% if inline_query_capture_876234.size > 0 %}?{% endif %}{{ inline_query_capture_876234 | remove_first:'&' }}","headers":{% capture header_capture_9023987234 %},"Accept":"application/json","Content-Type":"application/json"{% if auth["bearerAuth"]["AccessToken"] != nil %},"Authorization":{{ auth["bearerAuth"]["AccessToken"] | prepend: 'Bearer ' | json: false }}{% endif %}{% endcapture %}{{ '{' }}{{ header_capture_9023987234 | remove_first:',' }}},"body":{{ '{' }}"type":"json","data":{% if call["args"]["body"] != nil %}{{ call["args"]["body"] | unwrap_add_props | json: false }}{% else %}null{% endif %}}}

Response.Name: response201
Response.Description:
Order placed successfully

This endpoint returns an [```ApiResponse```]($h/__additional_documentation/Utilities/ApiResponse) instance.

Headers.Name: Location
Headers.Description: URL of the created order resource

Nodes.Text: The following parameters are configurable for the HttpConfiguration:
Properties

Data:
Establishes network connection and caches them for reuse.
*Default*: `http.DefaultTransport`

Nodes.Text: The httpConfiguration can be initialized as follows:
Represents the logging configurations for API calls.
Methods

Data: Takes in your custom implementation of the LoggerInterface. **Default: `ConsoleLogger`**
Defines the log message severity (e.g., DEBUG, INFO, etc). **Default : `Level_INFO`**
Toggles the global setting to mask sensitive HTTP headers in both requests and responses before logging, safeguarding confidential data. **Default : `true`**
The logging configurations for an API request.
The logging configurations for an API response.

Nodes.Text: Usage Example
Client Initialization with Custom Logger

In order to provide custom logger, any implementation of the `LoggerInterface` can be used so that you can override the `Log` behavior and provide its instance directly in the SDK client initialization.
The following example uses [`Logrus`](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/sirupsen/logrus) implementation of `LoggerInterface` for QrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApiClient initialization.
Represents the logging configurations for API requests.
Methods

Data: Toggles the inclusion of query parameters in the logged request path. **Default : `false`**
Toggles the logging of the request body. **Default : `false`**
Toggles the logging of the request headers. **Default : `false`**
Includes only specified request headers in the log output. **Default : `[]string{}`**
Excludes specified request headers from the log output. **Default : `[]string{}`**
Logs specified request headers without masking, revealing their actual values. **Default : `[]string{}`**

Nodes.Text: Represents the logging configurations for API responses.
Methods

Data: Toggles the logging of the request body. **Default : `false`**
Toggles the logging of the request headers. **Default : `false`**
Includes only specified request headers in the log output. **Default : `[]string{}`**
Excludes specified request headers from the log output. **Default : `[]string{}`**
Logs specified request headers without masking, revealing their actual values. **Default : `[]string{}`**

Nodes.Text: The following parameters are configurable for the RetryConfiguration:
Properties

Data:
Whether to retry on request timeout.
*Default*: `true`

Interval before next retry. Used in calculation of wait time for next request in case of failure.
*Default*: `1`

Overall wait time for the requests getting retried.
*Default*: `0`

Used in calculation of wait time for next request in case of failure.
*Default*: `2`

Nodes.Text: The retryConfiguration can be initialized as follows:

```go
package main

import (
    "qrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi"
)

func main() {
    retryConfiguration := qrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi.CreateRetryConfiguration(
        qrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi.WithMaxRetryAttempts(0),
        qrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi.WithRetryOnTimeout(true),
        qrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi.WithRetryInterval(1),
        qrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi.WithMaximumRetryWaitTime(0),
        qrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi.WithBackoffFactor(2),
        qrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi.WithHttpStatusCodesToRetry([]int64{408, 413, 429, 500, 502, 503, 504, 521, 522, 524, 408, 413, 429, 500, 502, 503, 504, 521, 522, 524}),
        qrBasedRestaurantManagementSystemApi.WithHttpMethodsToRetry([]string{"GET", "PUT", "GET", "PUT"}),
    )
}
```
Represents the result of an API call, including response metadata and the returned data of type `T`.
